newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: PNOC-EC says Calauit oil well not viable.
newsitem.headline: PNOC-EC says Calauit oil well not viable.

text.p: The Philippine National Oil Exploration Co-Exploration Corp (PNOC-EC) is abandoning its Calauit oil drilling in southwestern Philippines after tests showed excess water, the Department of Energy said on Wednesday.

"PNOC-EC evaluated the production logs and determined that continuing the Calauit-1B into extended production is not anymore technically and economically viable due to high water production," DOE director Griselda Bausa said in a drilling report.
Bausa said that test flows yielded 80 to 100 percent water.

PNOC-EC started an extended production test on the offshore well last May 15 hoping to flow 10,000 barrels of oil per day (bopd). The well flowed oil in certain intervals but never near the 10,000 bopd target.
PNOC-EC leads a 10-member consortium that decided to test the well abandoned by its former operator in 1991.
All of the members were local oil exploration firms except for Sydney Oil Co Drilling and Exploration Trust.
